meanings.definition: The action or state of setting someone or something apart from others.
meanings.sent1: In the classroom, the teacher used segregation to separate the students into groups for a project.
meanings.sent2: The segregation of the toys into different bins made it easier for the children to find what they wanted to play with.
meanings.sent3: During the game of tag, the children decided to play a funny game of segregation by only allowing certain players to tag others.
meanings.sent4: The segregation of the puzzle pieces into color-coded sections helped the child quickly complete the puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The segregation of the books on the shelf by genre made it simple for the librarian to locate specific titles.

meanings.definition: The enforced separation of different racial groups in a community.
meanings.sent1: In the past, segregation based on race was a common practice in many parts of the country.
meanings.sent2: The segregation of neighborhoods based on race led to unequal access to resources and opportunities.
meanings.sent3: At the school dance, the students jokingly suggested a game of segregation by segregating the dance floor by hair color.
meanings.sent4: The segregation of the colors in the rainbow is a natural phenomenon that creates a beautiful spectrum.
meanings.sent5: The segregation of the ingredients in the recipe made it easier for the chef to follow the cooking instructions.
